column4: hey, how do i know if ubuntu is using both my cores in my centrino duo?
when you do uname -a do you see the letters SMP any where?
then I would say no its not using it
if you go to synaptic, and scroll down to the linux-686 there should be an smp kernel there.
after you install and reboot come back. I think there are some things and /proc and /sys you can check
yep it looks like its working now. it will show core 0 and core 1
if i delete the 386 entries from grub, will that be a big problem?
also, did you install the 386 or the 686?
no not at all. but its always safe to leave an extra just incase... but you know the 686 smp works because you are using it now
ok. so i am all set now?
i would say so. unless anyone else has anything to add about getting dual cores working... just SMP right?
all looks good. system resources also shows it.
good deal. everything should be working.   you are welcome.
